snippet: Though legislators signed a pledge to turn over the redistricting process to an independent panel, in Albany, as they say, it is déjà vu all over again.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, who sought an independent redistricting panel, is trying to negotiate a deal that would allow Legislature to determine district lines this year in exchange for promise of a constitutional amendment that might improve the process, after the 2020 census; deal taking shape is being derided by advocates for black and Hispanic New Yorkers who say their communities are denied fair representation in the Legislature's proposed maps, and reformers who say it is unacceptable to put off change for another decade.
lead_paragraph: Though legislators signed a pledge to turn over the redistricting process to an independent panel, in Albany, as they say, it is déjà vu all over again.

headline.seo: New York Legislators Propose a Revised Redistricting Plan
headline.main: Albany Redrawing Political Map With Old Lines of Thought
headline.print_headline: Albany Redrawing Its Political Map With Old Lines of Thought
